title: Intro to Ifa
text:
What is Ifá?
The traditional spritual system of the Yoruba people of West Africa. It is a system of divination, and a way of life. It is a system of ethics, and a way to connect with the divine.

Isese L’Abga
Isese is the traditional spritual tradition of the Yoruba people in southwestern Nigeria. It is the original of the three major paths of Ifá. Video


Santería / Lucumí / Regla de Ocha
Santería is the afro-cuban tradition of Ifá. It is the result of the Yoruba people being brought to Cuba as slaves and mixing with the local population. It is the second of the three major paths of Ifá.


Candomblé

title: Intro to Ifa
text:
Stages of Initiation

Hand of Ifa / Íṣẹ́fá / Mono de Orula
The Hand of Ifa is the first step in the process of initiation into Ifa. The initiaion is typically a three day long ritual, though sometimes it is done in one. What you will recieve will vary depending if you are initiating in a house that is Isese, Santería, Candomblé. At the very least you will recieve a (1) bracelet(Idé Ifá) which will be either green and brown or green and yellow. (2) A divination that will give you information about your destiny and your taboos. (3) An Ifá shrine which have Ikin(scared palm nuts) also called It is the first step in the process of becoming a priest of Ifa. It is the first step in the process of becoming a Babalawo.


Warrior / Guerreros / Guerreros

title: Intro to Ifa
text:
Initiations

Hand of Ifa / Íṣẹ́fá / Mono de Orula
The Hand of Ifa is the first step in the process of initiation into Ifa. The initiaion is typically a three day long ritual, though sometimes it is done in one. What you will recieve can vary depending on the lineage you are initiating into be it Isese, Santería, or Candomblé. At the very least you will recieve (1) A divination that will give you information about your destiny and your taboos. (2) A bracelet(Idé Ifá) which will be either green and brown or green and yellow. (3) An Ifá shrine which have Ikin(scared palm nuts) also called It is the first step in the process of becoming a priest of Ifa. It is the first step in the process of becoming a Babalawo.


Warrior / Guerreros / Guerreros
